review: I've eaten at this location a few times and unfortunately it has gone downhill.  Service: It seems this is a roll of the dice. Some report good service, others say service was terrible. We had a server that was either inexperienced or didn't care. We ordered 3 drinks and she brought them out individually over a span of 15 mins?! When she took our order she didn't mention any of the specials, but did try to up-sell us. She came by once to check on us, but by that time we were almost done eating. I was cautious about touching the iPad device on the table, who knows how often they clean them? Prices: I noticed the prices went up since my last visit which isn't too surprising. The issue is they're at a price point that it's not worth it to go there. For $12 I expect a large gourmet burger and a heap of fries, which I didn't get. For half the price I can get a top burger at Carl's. I also ordered a draft beer which cost $5.40 for the 16oz, (WTF?)! I guess this is to off-set the happy hour prices? Never again.. Food: in a nutshell it is a poor value. I ordered the Boss Hog burger and of course didn't look anything like the picture. It was suppose to be pulled pork atop a beef patty, instead it was a few slivers of pork, I really had to look for it. The bottomless fries only works if you have an attentive waitress, which we didn't.  Fortunately we have a lot choices in T.O. when comes to restaurants. RR has lost me as a customer...

I'm not sure why I'm actually here AGAIN, every time we come, it takes forever to get a waiter to even bring us water, we are so parched by the time we get it and they leave and say "be right back to take your order" ...................my 50th Birthday  is soon approaching before they come back to actually rushing us and taking it.... We found out he wasn't even our waiter but was happy to take as long as we were on the ball about it......I feel rest assured that he repeated it all back but wait..... let see what happens???? Ok still waiting..... It's now been 30... I will say the manager came over and was sincerely nice but it's always the same excuse..... the restaurant is maybe 50% full and she tells us that corporate didn't forecast right for tonight's crowd.... oh and they are staffing tighter because of the minimum raise hike, seriously..........I think she was almost embarrassed as she also mentioned the other manager was in the kitchen cooking our dinner. Food is here about 40 minutes later and yep, two out of the 3 orders is wrong....oh and overcooked..... This isn't their fault..... it's mine, I must be a glutton for punishment....and Red Robin, you should be seriously ashamed how you run this business and how you run your employees to the ground.... shame on you and shame on me for coming back, it will be my last.

So we decided to come here for a burger  The service always sucks shit here  Ridiculous. Food is ok but the service sucks  Just sayin. I could have driven to Alaska and back before our order was taken

Horrible experience today waiting for more than 45 minutes to get our order, and then just one order of fries came. When we ordered two full orders that came with burgers and fries. I had to go get the manager, and the manager asked what table are you sitting in, I pointed towards our table, and then she said " oh #12" As though I know the numbers of the tables.  Come on, I don't work there, and No, there no numbers posted. She went to go find out about our orders, never apologized, nor said anything about how long before we get our food. WORST MANAGER EVER

One of my favorite casual burger spots - great variety of burgers including price ranges, really good salads, sandwiches are great, and pretty good entrées. They are usually pretty crowded due to popularity so easier to just order take out - have been doing do for the past few years. Really good website ordering so you can customize to the Nth degree if you want. Relocated to a new area 4 mos ago and tonight was our 5th attempt at ordering to go. As usual, the website was perfect - it remembered our location of choice and was easy to log on to our loyalty account. As usual, finished the order and got the confirmation saying my order would be ready at 7:59pm. As usual,  I arrived on time to check in at the time the current confirmation told me to. As usual, the hostess told me they were working on my order. At 8:10pm I asked the hostess if she could check on my order since I could see a few to go orders being packed from where I was standing  and saw one of the bags get moved to a heat lamp. The hostess never came back. At 8:14pm a young man came to deliver a to go order but the customer had left for a moment. He saw me watching and asked if I was waiting for an order - I said yes and gave my wife's name- he said that my order was ready except for my drink (my order was the one on the heat lamp and had been there for about 5 min before I was told it was ready). He came back with my drink immediately and started to verify my order. I noticed there was no teriyaki sauce and no garlic bread - which is the norm for this location to forget. As he went to retrieve the missing items, I tasted one of the French fries and noticed that it was cold. Its 8:20 now and family expecting food so I didn't make the Temps an issue. Got home and salads on came with 1 mini cup of dressing and no breads sticks for the kids meal and the fruit was shabby at best. Been a fan for many years but this location is a no-go for me going forward. I hope this gets read by management there cause I can't get their attention while I'm in the restaurant.

Southern charm burger is to die for!! Of all the Red Robins this is the only one in Ventura County that seats based on age group (21+, teens, and kiddies) which I think is a great idea!! If you don't have children typically, you don't want to sit around a bunch of screaming kids. I speak for all the RR with the next few comments..It would be cool if they brought out fresh fries from the beginning not when you ask for a refill. Other than that, service is usually slow. I will say, I went to the RR off E Main St in Ventura, the waitress was rather attentive! So kudos to her!

I typically love going here on occasion. My family of 10 recently went to dinner here and we got pretty bad service. My father has a gluten allergy so he order something off their gluten free menu, when they brought all the food to the table they gave my dad his meal but it wasn't the gluten free option he ordered. Alongside that we got the wrong drinks and one of the burgers was made incorrectly. With that being said while everyone got there food some of us had to wait another ten minutes for the correct meals to be brought out.

Used to love Red Robin but lately it seems the food and service have not been as great as before. I don't expect greatness when I go into a burger chain but often they make up for it with their service. I have to say, Red Robin's service is mediocre, at best. It seems that any location I've been to, they are always under staffed and we have to wait quite a while to place an order or pay the check.

The staff deserve 5 stars, our waitress was very attentive and friendly. There was absolutely no wait on a Friday night which was cool. They have happy hour specials that seem good but when I went it wasn't happy hour time. They have bottomless fries which is a cool concept but i doubt people will eat more than 2 orders of fries lol the garlic cheese fries were delicious. The mac and cheese was average. I tried the vegan burger it was good. You can ask for any of their burgers to come with the vegan patty. I had the sangria, it was decent. My friend had a burger and a beer. He said his meal was average. They have the little machine thing, you can order things and you pay using it too. I would go back during happy hour but it wouldn't be my first choice to eat.
The waiters and staff were beyond friendly. It was my first time dining at a Red Robin but if I had to go again I would definitely pick this place.

Waiting for a movie to start at the theater next door, I popped into Red Robin for a quick bite to eat as I came directly from work and knew I wouldn't be able to eat again until after the movie.  It was a Tuesday night so the restaurant was fairly quiet.  There wasn't a host when I walked in so I thought it was a seat-yourself deal (shows you how often I frequent Red Robin) and I went into the bar area and had a seat at one of the high top tables.  It's so 1990's restaurant like (not in decor, but in business concept) though the decor could use a good overall.  The bathroom were sticky and smelled. At the table, nobody came even though several servers walked right past me.  I tried several times to get the bartender's attention but she didn't notice me either.  I was going to have to get up and walk over to the bar, which I did, and asked if there was a server on duty.  She was apologetic and went into the kitchen and told me someone was coming.  Nobody came even though several servers walked right past me.  Finally, a guy who just started his shift introduced himself and took my order. He checked on me occasionally and made sure my drink was topped off.  He was a good server.  He wasn't over the top, but also not a grump either.  I got a burger and 'bottomless' fries.  I don't get that concept.  Who wants to keep filling themselves up with french fries?  The burger came out surprisingly fast and then I understood the 'bottomless fries' concept.  You're given such a small portion (maybe 8-10 fries), most people would probably keep asking for more.  I don't really like fries, so I just ate the first portion and I was content.  It's a big burger and I've got to say, it's one of the better burgers I've had in awhile.  The patty is flavorful and the toppings don't soak the roll but blend nicely together.   I hardly doubt I'll return as this is pretty far from where I live, but if you want a burger, it's a good place to drop in.

Dropped in around lunch time on the day after Christmas. The place was busy but we didn't have to wait more than 10 minutes for a table. Our server was great, attentive, came around and asked if we needed our fries refilled, no issues with our orders.  Other staff members came by to see how we were doing, one gentleman refilled our drink. The food was delicious as it usually is.  The only issue was the restroom. Low on TP and paper littered the floor.

They probably have the spiciest burger on the planet. I couldnt finish it without removing the fried jalapeno, the not fried jalapeno and gulp a lot of ice cold water. But im not blaming them, they gave me exactly what I asked for. Our waitress, Christina, was very pleasant. I thought it was me, but I was wrong, again, shes just being nice to everybody. Smily and taking the time to explain whats on the menu beyond the plain old burger. I liked it and will come back again when around.

I was just accused and lectured by the manager of this establishment about underage drinking after they saw my wife drinking my alcoholic drink. I guess our server Chloe didn't even have the courage just to ask my wife for ID, instead our server straight up escalated it to the manager who immediately approached us like we were criminals of sort. There was not even a polite request for her ID. We immediately even offered to show our ID as well and went to obtain the ID to prove that we were over 21 without further causing a scene like the manager was in front of everyone. Even after the incident, there wasn't any apology at all from either Chloe or the manager.  They even seemed to purposely left our order hanging for more than 45 minutes and never came by once to tell us about our order while the other groups around us received their order.  Definitely a horrible experience with the manager and the server of this restaurant.

I'll give it 1 star for fond memories. I used to be a regular at the old Agoura location before it closed down forcing me here.  It's the mall so parking is horrible and I'd say 30% of the time, I just keep driving and find another restaurant with the wife. The last two times have pretty much diminished any desire I have to return to this location. A year or so ago, the place was upbeat, the bartenders friendly, and always on top of things. These last 3 trips have been a literal embarrassment. I stopped in for a late lunch (around 3PM) and the place was pretty much empty except for the bar area. Usually I just grab myself a seat at the bar and be on my way. No one showed up in the bar for about 10 minutes. When they finally did, I was able to at least get a appetizer and drink in. 10 min later the water comes, and maybe 10 after that the appetizer shows up. (In this time, the staff hadn't even returned to take an order. Ended up standing my menu vertically to get their attention) Asked for place settings multiple times, was never provided any until I had fully eaten. Looking around it looks like there was maybe 3 people on-staff the entire time. The cook, the manager, and maybe 1 hostess. It's been like that fairly frequently. The entire bar area was a pretty uncomfortable scene with multiple people complaining about the incredibly long waits. As I left, there was a couple arguing with the manager about the service, so I wasn't the only one. The manager didn't even really seem to care about the complaints and the answer was "If you're hungry, you can always eat elsewhere!"  It's easier for me to cut my losses and just stop coming here. I felt like I honestly wasted my money there for sub-par food. This place also has a nasty habit of "forgetting" you had an appetizer/salad order and it just sits on the prep table until you either mention it or they realize it's there. Not cool for you to deliver an appetizer to a group, and then minutes later bring the entree. They say unlimited fries, which I now understand. The old Agoura location was pretty nice and would just set a basket of fries next to your entree. Here it's like they find the 9 soggiest fries they can and put it in the basket. Really... 9 fries? The last few times I felt like I needed to know ahead of time what I wanted or I'd be in for a wait.  Think I saw my server make 3 times in almost an hour. Maybe the manager changed, but boy this place is a disaster. Just save yourself the time. I can't even bring myself to go in for the free burger anymore. Red Robin in Agoura, Never Forget.

What a genuine Rip Off! we went there for burgers and fries and not only were they really expensive, but they weren't that great either! Then as if to add insult to injury, they had the gall to charge us a $3 entertainment fee!!! are you kidding me right now.  Never again! Hamburgers for 2 -- $35!
Food is good but the service is toooo slow :( Also the place need so e fresh air .... I hope they will improve the service there so i will be more motivated to take my kids there more often.
Had the BBQ burger and it was delicious!! The new atmosphere was wonderful! The service was a little slow but that's to be expected on a Saturday night! The place was packed.

Worst service ever! Waited to be seated for almost 5 minutes because no host/hostess was at the front seating station. Got the order completely wrong (ordered it with no mayo as I'm allergic), brought it back a second time and I'm convinced they just microwaved the burger and put it on a new bun because it was dry as hell. Asked for a knife and was handed a plastic one in a bag, was told it was because they were out of clean silverware. Never got a refill on my soda even after I asked her in twice in passing. Oh! and to top it off it was my daughters birthday (she was even wearing a pink headband that says "Happy Birthday"). I also mentioned it to her right when we sat down so that they could come sing for her. Ordered a few sundaes for the kids including the Birthday Girl. Never did she/they come sing Happy Birthday and of course she charges me for my daughter's complimentary sundae. Love Red Robin in general but I would steer clear of the one at the Thousand Oaks Mall. Obviously poor management and inexperienced servers.

Very good burger although i only realized that if it's togo, the sweet potatoe fries easily gets saggy, not unless if u have to throw it back to the oven. yes as far as ive checked other reviews, service is slow but that makes it up for the nice staff around. i also ordered the Towering Onions and it was still crispy when i get back to office.

Food was ok at best (soggy chicken strips), but took forever for the server to take our order and took about 10-15 minutes just to flag down the server for napkins, silverware and a refill and all while being quiet and not even close to busy. Bathroom was also exceptionally dirty with trash all over the floor.

The food and service is very good.  I have to point out that we came with our infant twins and the server (and other staff) were so nice to us.  They let us sit where we wanted because we didn't want to disturb others. We had requested that.   It helped us have an enjoyable lunch.  I got the Southern burger which was excellent.  My got the Black and Blue burger.  We both really liked the onion rings.

I went there 2 days ago and we pedestal a chicken tenders with fries, side fruit salad, coke, and Cesar salad  The service was slow and we had to keep calling the waiter for refills  Other that, it was ok... And I will go there again and hopefully service will be a bit faster.

I realize I'm writing a review of a burger place from a vegetarian perspective . . . But hey it's 2017, so if a restaurant is going to offer vegetarian options they should be held accountable for their taste. The Bocca Burger I ordered was one of the worst things I've ever tasted in my entire life. That is not hyperbole. It neither looked nor tasted like any Bocca Burger I've seen in person or could find online. It was more like pinkish Solyent Green. The manager replaced the Bocca Patty with their Garden Burger ... it was also unlike any Garden Burger I've  ever seen! Both were soggy, mushy, textureless and flavorless. The manager confirmed that both are MICROWAVED. I politely explained that I don't see the point of indulging in a restaurant meal to get microwaved frozen food. She vehemently insisted they were both "quite popular"...which I highly doubt. She took the Bocca burger off the bill...but that's not really the point. An evening out - even at Red Robin - should be a treat, not mushy microwaved food that you could prepare better at home. Although it's convenient, I won't be back to this RR. I'll be at Habit Burger where they know how to make a veggie burger without a microwave. Also, lost points for the filthy iPad "entertainment system" on the table...which is full of gross, greasy fingerprints and they CHARGE you $1.99 for your kids to use it.

Worst service ever! Tried this place before and the food came out cold. My second time here was not any better. They brought me the wrong burger and FORGOT to remake the correct one. How does that happen? Never coming back, especially to this location. Save yourself a trip and go next door to lazy dog which is WAY better.

The burgers are tasty but the seating is a pain. You cannot sit in the general area because of the kids' noise, so we sat in the bar area. It was a cool spring day, and all the boots were located right under a blasting air conditioner. The tables in the middle  were really tall and the chairs were bar stools.  Next time, I will do a take-out. The seating arrangement takes away the pleasure of eating their delicious burgers.

I went there today with a friend for an early lunch. Normally I have a great experience and the food has always been good. But today, I saw someone I went to HS with. We used to be friends and whatnot. I am pretty sure she was suppose to serve my table, but for some reason she decided not to serve the table today. And for what reason I do not know.
Their place is great. I love the fact that we can get French fries as much as you want. And their new remodel is very nice.

This place is great. The Red Robin seasoning is addictive on the bottomless fries, the burgers are great, and the margaritas are to die for. you might not expect it, but the Ultimate Margarita is one of the best Margaritas I've ever had hands down. I come here quite a bit and the service is excellent every time. I'm not sure the formula Red Robin used to get ahead of the competition (johnny rockets and other similar burger joints), but they are much, much better than the rest.
The service here is NOT what it used to be. We used to love coming here. Recently, it's taken forever to get any sort of service. We left this time after 20 mins of waiting. Terrible.

So today I went to grab lunch at this Thousand Oaks location.  Ordered the Crispy chicken salad with honey mustard dressing. Its my favorite. But there was a long curly light brown hair in it. I immediately requested another salad. But they still charged me for the salad. Wouldnt you think they would at least give me my lunch for free. These girls need to have their hairs up. I guess I have to drive down to Ventura from now on.
Went here on Martin Luther King's holiday. Better service and food quality was better. However, walking in you still passed a number of dirty tables that were just sitting there...

Went here last night (August 31). Awful service. We were sat right away but the chair was wet. I literally wiped the wet seat with my sleeve before sitting down right in few of the hostess. The table was so sticky, honestly really disgusting. We sat there for about 10 minutes before we were greeted by our server. She took our drink and app order and it took another 10 minutes to get our waters and our appetizer never came. We called our server over and ordered our burgers. It took 40 MINUTES for our food to come. It was 7:45pm on a Thursday night. There were only a few other tables. Pretty dead. We also watched our server put a beer down in front of a likely underage gentlemen at the table next to us and then AFTER he took a sip she asked "You're 21 right?". We were floored. Our server also touched our fries with her bare hands right on the line. EW. I've worked in a restaurant for close to 4 years and have held a Food Handlers Card the entire duration. You are NOT suppose to touch food with your bare hands. Anyways... we got our food, it was mediocre. I would have spoke to a manager but it was hard enough to wrangle a refill so we just payed and left. Thank god for the at table payment system because we probably would have been there until 11pm if we had to wait for our server. I like Red Robin but it was very disappointing.

Seriously these guys took great care of us this afternoon.  From the hostess, to the server, to the guy that brought us 3 (!!!!) baskets of fries, to the manager that gave us a military discount (NOT standard at Red Robin) - they were awesome!  Made our trip up the coast that much better!  Much love from Humboldt!

I should have known better, because this isn't the first time I've eaten here nor the first time I've told myself, "I'm never coming back to this place".  But, after a day of shopping with my daughter, this seemed the most reasonable of the restaurant choices available for a quick bite.  Or so we thought . . .  Parking for any of the restaurants in this location is the worst, but that's not the reason for the low rating.   The main reason is for their prices.  $9 for an order of onion rings?!?!?  REALLY?!?!?  Ok, I got over that thinking of the big bowl of clam chowder soup that was coming.  Or was it?  We were told by 3 different people that they "had to make a new batch and it would be a few minutes until it was ready".  Okay.  20 minutes went by and still no soup.  By now, the onion rings were gone and we were still waiting.  Finally, the server brings us our bowls (not cups) of soup.  We both stared at each other as we could not believe this small thing was the BOWL size!  No kidding, the BOWL was really a 4 inch by 4 inch SQUARE.  We laughed just thinking if this was the bigger size, what does the cup size look like?  So we ate our "freshly made" soup and laughed at how many undercooked pieces of potato were in it.  Overall, not a good experience, once again, and much too pricey for what we ordered.  Our bill was a little over $30 for an order of onion rings, 2 bowls of soup, 1 coke, and 1 soda water.   As we attempted to pay the bill on the electronic pad at the table, I noticed I was charged $2.99 for my soda water.  I've ordered soda water in restaurants my entire life and I have never been charged for it.  Anywhere.  No lie.  I asked our server if it was a mistake on the bill, and after getting an apology, I was told that charging for soda water was something they "recently started doing".  That pretty much ended it for me right there for good.  Not ever going back.

I've been here a couple of times and this time it's just been bad. Our server didn't even bother coming to ask us how our food was at all. She didn't tell us our food would take awhile due to a lot of orders. Which I completely understand but it would be nice if she checked up on us once in awhile. The only real complaint is that I order an appetizer and it took 40 minutes.. It was pretty sad. Overall the food was great but the waitress needs to Improve on actually checking up on the table instead of coming to check on us when we're done eating.

Reviewing the menu you see pictures of Gourmet Burgers, juicy, cheese hanging off the edge, BBQ sauce dripping. What you actually get is a burger half the height of the picture, a dry Bun/Meat and if you look closely you may find a little BBQ sauce somewhere in there. The endless fries were dry and no amount of Ketchup could save them. To top off the experience, there was a real piece of day old Brockley, flattened  in between the pages of the menu. We pointed it out to our waiter and he left it as is. Now the next person will be able to enjoy it too.

Im beyond impressed. I cant even breathe. This experience was the best experience at any restaurant hands down. This must of been a piece of heaven because from the moment we walked in, to our food, to us leaving. Such extrodinary service!!!Karina was our host and when I say host I mean it started with her. I felt like royalty and she treated me amazing! She complimented my dress and made conversation. She was far from a host robot im use to. She should be on her way up, because customer service with a smile is very rare now days. Our food was definately heaven sent. The boneless wings are the best I have ever had, and what sucks is hooters is right down the way and their wings are a 2 on a scale, where red robin hits that 10 easy! Our server Julie was sooooo funny and sweet, and she was not in a hurry to leave considering it was 930pm on a Thursday. The ice cream machine broke and even though it was a big inconvenience she didnt show it. The show must go on, and she did so well.....she excels at multi tasking and kept all her tables satisfied and attended to. I would really appreciate it, if my review was sent to Corporate. Corporate needs to be aware of this particular location. Im 29, and I've been to alot of restaurants, lots of fancy expensive ones and its sad to see that theu can not provide the service that was given here tonight. I will definately be a regular here and will be bringing all my family and friends. Thank you to Karina the host and Julie our server for making this experience one we will never forget!!! Ever! P.S I love the new happy hour menus and times. Love the new food items, and im a HUGE fan of wings and Ive tried so many all over the world  and yours are STILL my favorite! Keep up the good work!!! Racquel & Angel Hernandez

My first visit to this location. I've always had great service at Red Robin locations. The service was great, and the people were super friendly. Chloe, my server was awesome, super quick on refills, and we chatted a bit about books as I was reading an Irvine Welsh (of Trainspotting fame or infamy depending on your view) book. Their turkey burger is awesome. And I like that you can substitute a salad over the fries. They have a great selection of beers (both national, international, and local). I didn't do dessert this time, but there are many intriguing selections on their menu. Ingrid the manager has an excellent crew here. Keep up the great work!  Definitely will be back as their holiday shakes will be coming along.

Horrible service. Sat down at the table at 9:30; drinks were finally given to us at 10, the food (ordered right when we sat down) was at the table at 10:20. The waitress was too busy talking to her friends that were coming in. They got their drinks and food within 15 minutes of sitting down. Never will go back.
Below average burgers. Dirty. God awful service. If I could turn back time, I would find a way to avoid

Food was good but the service was awful. They did not bring the correct order. They brought out drinks and forgot to bring one or two peoples drinks and then took another 5- 10 minutes to bring those two drinks. They brought the food but did not bring any forks knives or napkins. We had to ask for that. They took forever to refill drinks and french fries and only brought the drink refills after having to ask a manager. Overall it was a very unfortunate eating experience. I do not recommend this location.

It started out great, my family & I sat down and as soon as our server came to the table we ordered our food. Unfortunately after waiting 45 minutes the server came by to inform us she forgot to put in our food order. She was extremely apologetic and said she would put the food in on fast track. She also said she would inform her manager. Her manager came by and rather then offer to discount our food order she dropped off pretzel bites. By that time we had been waiting almost an hour. I'm not one to expect something for nothing however paying $50 dollars for a meal that came out over an hour late does not seem right. This review is not directed towards the server, It is solely directed towards the Inconsiderate manager for not at least offer a gift card or discounting our food cost. We will not return!

My family has noticed a significant improvement with customer service and attentiveness and pleasant attitudes at Red Robin and I believe the new general Manager Brooke is to credit. My family are big red robin fans starting our loyalty in Seattle and keeping the momentum in So Cal. We have been in the area for three years and have seen the decline of service and now see the amazing and fun service we are consistently receiving. What warrants this review today was the outstanding service of Katelyn and her manager Brooke. I didn't have online success with a promotion and was reassured I can make my order over the phone and they would honor the promotion. I anticipate I would have to show the team my good faith effort and they were very receptive and understanding and kept their word. I am satisfied with the customer service and thrilled about this improvement overall and dine in. With a three year old in tow, I pay for the convenience and this reasonable person appreciates when a restaurant delivers. Thank you again Brooke and Katelyn.

This is a great location to have your burger fix satisfied. They have a variety of burgers and other food options avaliable in which you will be able to take advantage. I usually get their Burning Love which is topped with fried jalapeño coins, salsa, Pepper-Jack, lettuce, tomatoes and chipotle aioli on a jalapeño-cornmeal kaiser roll. This burger is an appetite filler and will have your stomach jumping for joy. You can wash it down with one of their Very Berry Raspberry Limeade that is refreshing and not too sweet. The staff is great as George will make sure your eeds are met.  Parking is not an issue, as you can park in their lot.

My family use to love Red Robin, but we won't go back to this location.  We waited forever to be greeted at the door.  And then pretty much every meal tasted old and stale.  Even the fries tasted like they had been from the day before.

I hadn't seen that the garden burger was a vegetarian burger, so the waiter was sweet enough to make me a new one with beef, no charge :-D While waiting for the food we played one of their many games, so funny. Bottomless sodas and fries was amazing og spices on the table was perfect :-D So tasty food!

Stopped here for a quick dinner before our movie last night.  Service was pretty quick and food was pretty good.  We tried the pretzel bites first.  I like the pretzel's at other places better, but these were okay too.  They're perfectly sized to eat in one bite or two.   Husband got the prime rib dip sandwich with sweet potato fries on the side.  The fries showed up barely warm, which was not very appetizing.  When they offered to bring us more (after we'd finished the first batch), we agreed and those ones came out warmer, though not tasting fresh out of the frier.  Husband liked the sandwich.  I tried the coleslaw and it tasted fine.   If I had come with more of an appetite we would have tried a dessert.  Hopefully next time. Women's restroom was in need of attention when I visited.  It was stocked with toilet paper and seat covers, but there was litter on the floor and one stall needed extra cleaning.
Passable for an overpriced family burger joint in a pinch. The mall was very nice though.

I'm just going to start off by saying that the food was good, as always, but our service was terrible. We saw our waitress, Jessica 3 times between 2:04 and 3:15. We felt ignored the entire time, I'm beyond frustrated with the service today.
Waited over 50 minutes with a group of 8. Left before being served! Manager was too busy to discuss!! 2 other groups left as well! Horrible! Will NEVER return.

Usually have ok food and decent service here, but the last time we went, bar service was terrible. Waitress made a point of asking other tables how they were but never came by to check on us once unless we flagged her down. Perhaps the other tables were her friends. Also, when is Red Robin going to realize their silver fry cups are terrible and the fries in them are always cold? So much worse than when they served in baskets next to the hot burger. It took 15 mins to get our beer brought out and 25 for our food. Fries were cold and not fresh. Sandwiches were good. They forgot our ranch so it made the fries even colder waiting for that, and hot refill fries took 10 mins. I don't fault them the time on a busy night but the disinterested service isn't ok. Won't be back.
Just okay. Not that great. Cheap Azz on bottomless fries. It's 2016. Potatoes are like 50 cents a pound.

Wholly Smokes!!!  The Absolute Best Customer Service I've received yet!!  Our waiter Joshua was Awesome!  Very friendly & extremely attentive!  Not ONLY did he check in on us but so did 2 other gentleman whom I'm guessing are Managers.  So stoked with the service & of course the YUMMY burgers.  Thank you Joshua & staff for the outstanding service!!  You guys Rock!!!
I absolutely love the food here! The hot wings are the best wings I have ever had. The service can be a little lacking but the food more than makes up for that.

We came around noon and sat out on the back patio. The server was on it. Even though we were the only customer outside he didn't seem to mind. He always made sure we were taken care and had full drinks and all we needed to be satisfied. Thank you!
Came here with my family this afternoon and it was better than we expected. Clean tables, nice staff and delicious food. we will definitely visit again

01/21/2016 - Three of us went to Red Robin in Thousand Oaks.  My first time at any Red Robin.  Service was quick and our waitress, Kylie, was outstanding.  She was very friendly, personable and attentive to our needs.  I had their original cheeseburger.  It was cooked to order and quite tasty.  The fries were tasty as well.  I will, at some point, make a return visit. Ted M. Simi Valley, CA.

Always great food, all the time! I go to red robin several times throughout the year, and this red robin is great!  Sometimes there is little bit of waiting to get a table, but is not bad as other restaurants.  The food quality is worth paying for and have a great selection of different varieties from their menu.  Overall the food and service is GREAT!

Love it. Yummy specially if you are on the gluten free diet they also cater to you. They have chicken, beef and fish. I love the strawberry freckled lemonade that when I would highly recommend in having Plus it's bottomless.

I will not go back anytime soon. We arrived around 1 pm. My family was greeted promptly and seated right away. After that nothing... Apparently our table had a no eye contact zone around it. This was frustrating, as there were fewer than half of the tables in use. After waiting 10 minutes for service we hit the call server on the tablet at the table. We waited 5 more minutes. I watched multiple servers and hostesses travel by our table; once again no eye contact. After this we left. If this was the first time this situation occurred, I would make like the Frozen movie and 'Let it go.'  However the last time we were at this establishment a similar situation occurred.  We waited at the table and had no service. That time, our waitress arrived right after we hit the request for service on the tablet and apologized that it was a communication error. Clearly that issue has not been resolved after several months. It is frustrating because the food is usually pretty decent.  If you are curious, when we left we went next door to Lazy Dog and had prompt service and excellent food.

I came here with my husband and daughter, we were seated right away but it took forever to get our food. The waitress kept apologizing because they had big parties even when we asked for fries because according to her all the parties wanted fries (in other words they were priority over us). We asked for fries 3 times before she brought them, never refilled or asked to refill our waters. The pizza on the kids menu had a pepperoni happy face and I specifically asked if it would look like that since my daughter wanted it really bad she said yes, the pizza came with no happy face when I asked she said, oh sorry we are so busy with all these parties, again telling us they were more important than us. Horrible service for the location.

I've been here several times. I find the establishment clean, good & friendly customer service, & half the time it's crowded.  Maybe I'm just lucky that I come in when it's not too busy or maybe they're not that popular.  Food has always been consistent.  Fresh burgers & unlimited fries, & tasty shakes.  I haven't had any problems here so far so I come back once in awhile. I recommend.

have been going there since it opened in TO.... Basically it' s run by kids and depends on who your server is.... is how great your experiance will go. The other evening hubby & I went in for some burger offer  ...$5.00 off which was all well and good exept for one thing...it became a comedy of errors.  Nothing major mind you but enough to notice. Asked for extra pickles...took awhile to " compute in the brain to actually putting it into action. 9/27/14: Just there lastnight with hubby.  Ordered the Turkey Burger since having Brisket twice in one week....BIG MISTAKE!! Burger tastedlike it was pre-made.  To add insult to injury...over salted. The waiter came over & said "we weren't the 1st  to complain as it is both pre-made elsewhere as well as iver salted"....also had  that "faketaste".... Manager came over to ask what the problem was.  Didn't seem to agree with my accessment basically saying that all our customers "absolutely lve it"...when in fact our waiter clearly statedthatmany customers complained about the same thing!! Couldn't even offer a dessert for the awful burger....too bad one of  ourmeals was free (for belonging to their club)....live & learn.....!!!

I went in with my wife and kids. They forgot everything I order. Food was cold and my sons milk was really warm. Worst experience I have ever had. Will never go back to that location. I'll make sure to tell people about my experience.

We ate here a week ago and ordered take out, the service was quick but they did get my order wrong I ordered no cheese and it was on the Royal red robin burger, I am lactose so I can't eat cheese so I scrapped as much as I could off, the food was good but after 1 hour I threw it all up and was sick, I have eaten here many times so maybe it was a one time thing or maybe something was contaminated but it will be a while before we come back!

Came here last night with my girlfriend for a date.  We used the deal that was $15=2 tavern burgers+ 1 appetizer/dessert.  What a deal!  I got a tall coors light for 4.50.  For the price, food was worth it. Our server, Mike, was really the one that made the date fun.  He was extremely helpful and accommodating.
Every time I come into this restaurant I leave very happy. Great service, very friendly and accommodating staff. They have some great deals during happy hour. The restaurant is always clean.

Summary: good food for a chain if you know what to order but your dinner will likely take twice as long at this location..literally. The good:  I am a fan of the whiskey river chicken sandwich and my son loves the clucks  n fries (ok - I like them too). Fish and chips are also good. Fries and root beer floats are unlimited. They have a good fry seasoning too. Very kid friendly and good vibe for a family meal.  The bad: Burgers are really not special. They got rid of the salmon.  This location: I grew up with RR in a different town and have been to many locations. So far this location had the worst service. There was no wait to be seated but it took a  long time to order and receive the food. The food was not hot upon arrival (probably sat for a while before delivery to the table). I asked for BBQ sauce and then didn't see the waitress for 15min. It took a long time to get the check- basically everything took twice as long as at any other RR. The waitress was super nice by the way, but she just wasn't on top of it. Maybe we came on the wrong day, but thw reastaurant was half empty when we sat down and I see other reviews with the same complaint about this being a slow restaurant. We have little kids and have been too afraid to go back for another 2 hour dinner.
I know it's New Year's Day, but RR just lost the business of my family and three others who went next door to their competitor in the past 5 minutes.  Dumb move, closing at 6pm.

I left two stars because I feel badly for our server. If she weren't nice, I would have given one star. I'm pretty sure she tried, but just had too many tables. They sat us at an outside and forgot us. 20 minutes later, a server approached us apologizing and took our drink order and food order. We sat thirsty with no drink refills and when our order finally came, my daughter's side was on its way next. And you know how the fry orders go...like 5 fries with your meal and you have to ask for more. So when we were done with our burgers and still waiting on my daughters broccoli, the server came to ask if we were all set. Told her we needed drink refills, broccoli, and a refresh of fries. Fries and broccoli came...no drink refills. I gave up. If you're going to try this location, do it on a slow night so that you may get some service. Otherwise I suggest checking out the neighboring restaurants.

Update. The owner did reach out to me and said they dropped the ball.  I appreciate this.  I may try this place again but not on a Friday night. I do need to wait a bit to let the image of the gross man settle a bit too. OMG. I could not make up this night if I tried.  The service here is beyond subpar. First we waited over 50 mins to get our food!  Wait for it...it came out cold. I watched my food sit in the window for at least 15 mins.  It was soup and a wrap. I knew it would be cold. My husband enjoyed his hamburger and fries as I sat there just watching him like a dog watches his owner when they have something they want to eat. The new wrap came out and it was great. But, about half way through It I realized it was the wrong kind of wrap.  At this point I don't care because I am starving and don't want to risk another 50 min wait.  For dessert, I got to watch the guy at the end of the bar brush his teeth( yes I did write at the end of the bar) spit in his glass and then he finished up with MOUTH WASH. I really think the gods did not want me to eat tonight. Because after that I was no longer hungry.  One star is being generous.

Absolutely horrific experience at this restaurant not once, not twice but three times. There is clearly no one running the front of the house and directing traffic for the bus and service staff. Repeatedly we saw servers who were far more involved socializing with coworkers or on their phones than anything to do with attending to paying customers. I normally don't give bad reviews because everyone is entitled to a bad day, but this place is an exception. We will never go back.

Normally I am pretty easy to please, and not a big food critic.. but my experience here was pretty horrific. My friend and I ordered an AMF and wasn't made correctly. Too much of the sweet and sour drink mix, and not enough alcohol. I got a BLT on croissant bread, and tortilla soup. The chicken in the soup you could tell was straight from a freezer and wasn't thawed out fully.The croissant was soggy by the time it was brought to me. My bill came out to $16, which I should of gone to the Cheesecake factory and spent that on a plate of delicious pasta instead.   It took about 30 minutes to get drinks, and 55 minutes to get food that was just plain bad. Was running late to see a movie, and when I asked the busser about the whereabouts of our food and drinks he just plain ignored me. When I confronted him when I was leaving, he was at a lost for words.  I originally chose this restaurant thinking it would be cheap, and service would be quick. This Red Robin was neither.

Food is decent. I just don't really care for Red Robin for gourmet burgers as much as I did when I was 17. The drinks are good. They are always willing to customize a drink for you if you don't like their selection. The service is friendly. It's a family restaurant.

So for a Sunday afternoon, a half full restaurant was a good bet for a nice meal and service. Wrong! Our waitress must have said "sorry" to us about a dozen times throughout the meal due to various reasons. The burgers were good and the second round of bottomless fries were better than the ones that came with the burger. Waited a long time for our food. Once our waitress figured that we were not pleased, she stepped it into second gear, so I give her props for that. Overall average, but could have been better.

Let me start off by saying that the food we ordered was fine... Well mostly. I ordered a bbq chicken sandwich with a salad. My salad was wilted and old. The server offered to bring me fruit that did not arrive until he brought our check. My son spilled his drink on our table and i cleaned it up but had to ask the server for a new replacement drink and although I didnt mind cleaning up my sons drink... He didnt seem too concerned with helping or even offering his help. He never once came around to ask if we were ok or to refill drinks once our food was delivered and the restaurant was far from full. Needless to say I will not be back.

No one took our drink order. Only the hostesses acknowledged our presence. Attempted to use the Ziosk for appetizers but it was not working. Selected the "Call Server" function which blinked for 20 minutes. We had to walk away. I was disappointed because we frequent the La Jolla and Torrance locations and thought the service would be the same. I was wrong.

My family just finished dinner at Red Robin and I wanted to write a nice review for them since it seems like they are more deserving of just 3 stars.  We usually visit this location about once a month and almost every time have received great food and service.  This evening's experience was no different and our burgers were very delicious.  My wife ordered the new Genisys burger and I ordered the new Southern Charm burger, both very good. The Genisys was quite hot and spicy because there was jalapeños in the burger, bun, and sauce.  My Southern Charm was juicy and sweet.  The BBQ sauce and onions really made the difference.  My almost 2-yr old daughter ordered grilled chicken and broccoli (her usual) from the kid's menu and it was nice and juicy, too.  Our server was Drew and he was friendly and fast. Our fries and drinks were refilled promptly and payment via their tabletop tablet was easy.  Overall, my wife and I always enjoy Red Robin burgers and find it quite nice that they are willing to create new menu items to keep it interesting.  We love coming here, despite dealing with mall parking. Highly recommend this family-friendly restaurant.

Red Robin is always my family's first choice for lunch. They have a huge variety on their menu and their pretzel appetizers are really good. If I am going to choose any place for lunch, it's always Red Robin. Just a creature of habit I guess.. Service there is also pretty good.

Hard to go wrong with bottomless fries and a fried egg atop your burger. Tonight I had the new ghost pepper burger with raw and fried jalepenos. Of course I had them add an egg (1.49 extra) and I requested two sample size servings of their premium dipping sauces (otherwise 75 cents each.) The chipotle sauce was okay and the sweet and spicy thai was a little better but nothing to write home (or yelp) about. Now it appeared to me that most, if not all, of the burgers came in two sizes, either a double...which you think would be the bigger of the two but isn't (it's two small kids size patties) or the big burger...which is a single thick patty (for $2 more.) Not wanting to over eat, I went with the "double" and it was plenty. Only drawback is you can't order your patty medium rare (or whatever you like) since the patties aren't thick enough. Service was very friendly and the kids were happy so hey, it was a win. Only real disappointment was the $5 dinner salad, which was about half the size of a Habit salad for the same price. They were also out of hard boiled eggs for my wife's Cobb salad, which was interesting since I was able to get a fried one on my salad (I'm guessing prepackaged for quality control.) Try it or Diet Final Word Try it. You could do a lot worse than Red Robin and its a lot cheaper than its in-mall competitor, Stacked (although Stacked is damn good.) Whatever you order, don't forget to put and egg on it and keep the steak fries coming.

Good burgers good beer they have a pos system setup,  you don't even have to talk to the waitress to place your order on an iPad computer and you have to pay on it no choice. if I'm doing all the work why would Ibe motivated to I leave a tip  TIPS.....to insure proper service......not a win here
The food here was not fresh. I called the manager and informed him,  but he didn't  come back to my table to replace my food. There are much better restaurants around to visit.

The star is for the server who really did try his best.  He actually deserves more stars, but the food was absolutely awful, and one of the kids in our group tore his toe open on a piece of metal on the bench seat and the waiter refused to give us a band-aid even though we knew they had band-aids.  He said his manager said no.  I guess they'd rather the kid bleed all over their floor.  Absolutely ridiculous.  We ended up getting a band-aid from Muvico.  If it's against your policy to give a bleeding kid a band-aid, you need to change your policy.

Good food, nice servers, clean and well kept. Bar is always stocked and the tenders cheerful. Food delicious and the waitresses on top of drink and fry refills. The only downside to this particular Red Robin is that during the week there are few servers so an extra 10 minutes might be added on to your dine time. Not bad considering there were only two today, to wait on 18+ tables worth of guests.

My boiiii drew is awesome! First time here, just in town for a quick business meeting, and he made my trip to red robin the bomb! Shout out drew keep slayin at red robin, owning that customer service! Solid food. Peace out!

Bottomless Root Beer Float -- those are 4 glorious words!  That's right peeps!  An all you can eat/drink root beer floats!  And, hold on...it's only $3.19.  Are you kidding me?  The other thing I love is that it is technically considered a "beverage", and not a "dessert".  OMG - OMG - OMG!   Speaking of drinks...HAPPY HOUR (M-F; 3pm-6pm; 8pm-close) --- Drinks, plenty to choose from, ranging from $2.50 to $4.50, and appetizers ranging from $3-$7.   Of course, they feature burgers and great steak fries (all you can eat with each order), but Red Robin's really do have a nice variety of a little everything: salads, pastas, soups, and more.  Selected by yours truly on this visit, a ROYAL RED ROBIN with bacon, an oozing fried egg, cheese...mmmmm ($10.49) with bottomless steak fries.  Watching carbs?  Substitute all you can eat broccoli!  Fantastic!  The burger taste very good, even though the patty itself could be better, the combo of flavors works. ======================= = UNIQUE LOCATION INFO = ======================= It feels new.  Fun environment, bright, 50's like.  It's great for kids.  The bar is kinda small and not much to speak of (plus, a little amateurish and not for manly men), so I wouldn't recommend just coming here for drinks, and certainly not a pickup bar! SERVICE --- Assisted by an electronic tablet on the table to "call server", it didn't seem to work.  Still, when the waitress did come, she was nice, sweet, and smiley.  Good combo.  OUTDOORS --- Nice outdoor patio area with plenty of heat lamps. CONCLUSION --- It's a 3.5 star rounded up.  Go here when you want a bite to eat without the hassle of Lazy Dog next door.  At 830pm on a Friday night it had a crazy wait with 25+ people waiting for a table.  Red Robin was a quarter full, and my dining companion and I sat down and order in peace.
Your Mushroom burger was awful, and I didn't appreciate the Ziosk on the table, it's just sad to me that computers are actually replacing cashiers. I will never return to your restaurant..

I can only assume an inflated sense of privilege has earned this place three stars. Hot food, kind staff. Christy and Emily who waited on me were both on point and attentive. I had the buffalo clucks and fries, delicious. Probably the best red robin I've been to in SoCal. Ample parking, theatre next door. Don't listen to the riff raff, judge for yourself.

Horrible service!! I've never not left a tip before & almost walked out of a place, but I couldn't find my server to ask for a box or order dessert. I will never eat here again!! Manager was unwilling to do anything about it. Wow, just wow.

Service was excellent but; had the pepper and Jack signature burger. They forgot to put cheese, but I didn't mention it because I was too hungry to wait and I'm generally shy about making a big deal in public. My wife ordered a croissant sandwich of some sort with fries. Mine came with fries as well. My infant had a childrens meal. Problem, my burger had no taste, my kids meal had some little meatballs that looked frozen and heated up with some little dry bread sticks. We had 1 fountain drink. I don't mind spending money to eat well, but the bill came out to $46 and we felt it wasn't worth the money. Red Robin needs to put some flavor back into the food!

My burger came to me with a cold patty. Both of  our fries were not even a bit warm. I would understand this (maybe) if the restaurant was packed but seeing as there is only 4 tables at the moment this is unacceptable. Definitely not coming back.

Stopped in the have a snack before our movie on Saturday afternoon.  Bathroom was dirty.  Paper towels on the sink and floor and empty toilet paper rolls in the stalls.  Was seated in the table next to a woman who continually coughed and blew her nose.  Took 30 minutes to get our order of fried zucchini.  Was never offered a refill on our drinks.  Halfway though our movie is when I got sick.  I think there was something wrong with the ranch dressing.  My husband got sick later and we spent the rest of the weekend ill.  Just an absolutely gross experience.  I don't know if I will ever be able to eat ranch dressing again.  I will NEVER eat at Red Robins again for sure.

Sad to say horrible burgers. Don't bother with the Tavern burgers . Better off getting mcdonalds . The wait for the food was an hours. Yes I timed it. And they were not even busy. No refills on the drinks or bothered to keep us up to date on our orders the manager was very condescending .

Place wasn't even busy and most of all the tables were dirty. And when we gotten out food the fries was cold and the burger was not made right. Wouldn't recommend this place at all. And as far as the tables being dirty there excuse was that they didn't have any busser but they weren't busy at all and I I saw was five staff standing around when they could be cleaning the tables. I'm a GM for another restaurant and who ever was the manger is on that shit need talking to cuz this restaurant has the potential but it's lacking the management.

We go here when we want a GOOD burger. We love their bottomless fries too! I always order the sweet potato fries...so yummy! Always crisp and HOT! Today my husband ordered the Genisys burger. He raved about it! This is a limited burger. Don't miss it. I ordered the Burnin Love Burger. Cooked to perfection. Quality meat. Very tasty. Our server Jessica was fabulous! Our drinks were always full and our French fries kept coming. I highly recommend you asking for her

It wasn't even busy, and they send the wrong fries to a different table. We waited for a whole 40 min for fries and a refill on our drinks. They kept saying sorry and no offer to take some % off our bill which came out to damn near $60 . I ordered a cheeseburger with no onions or tomatoes, and tomatoes came on my burger. I could have been allergic if they touched my food but I just took them off myself. We only left a $2 tip cause the wait was ridiculous and it was unnecessary.

Always great service in the bar if the restaurant is too crowded, and always amazingly great burgers. Had a great server last night named Drew who was quick, attentive and friendly, so just sayin, you can never go wrong at this place. Keep up the great work! And keep the bottomless fries a fryin!

Not sure why I keep ending up at chain restaurants with huge menus...but here I am.  This one isn't bad, actually.  Service was excellent, but might have been because we were the only diners in his section (11:00 on a Saturday.)  I had a grilled chicken sandwich which was really pretty good although the fries were kind of mushy.  My fiance had a seafood sampler...he liked it but it looked a bit too fried for my taste.

My wife and I go to this Red Robin (Oaks Mall location) at least twice a month.  We have tried many other locations and this one is by far the best.  She always orders the exact same thing, so it's quite easy to compare locations.  I don't understand so may poor reviews ... it's almost like the reviewers went someplace else - they are explaining something other than what I have experienced here.  We always sit in the bar area (no wild kids) and always have great service.  If there is a particular game you would like to watch the bartender is always happy to change at least one TV to your choice. Use your "Red Robin rewards card" as it's amazing how fast the meals add up and you are getting a free one.  You also get a free burger on your birthday month as well as freebies emailed to you.

Why do I come to Red Robin you Ask? Well I have kids and kids love the "Red" in the Robin or color scheme that is. This is a safe family place by the oaks. Next to the Lazy dog, yummy. But back to Red robins, I'll make this simple. Great burgers, great fries that's what i stick to. Funny cause i usually order the turkey burger with a side salad. My kid will have a cheeseburger with apple slices and water. Then she will have the peppercorn burger with a side salad. Usually runs about 40 dollars plus tip.  I don't sway much from those staples. Service is good. But it's always packed on fri, sat try the weekday for a quieter environment. Also parking is tuff on the weekends so drop your family off out front and let whom is driving park the car. " honey would you like to drive tonight my leg is cramping." Little tidbits of wisdom regarding the robin's franchise.

Since our kids love red robin, we went here for lunch. Even though we had an issue, I was very happy with how situation was handled. Had an issue with some soup we ordered. The server mentioned it before hand too. He brought me a new bowl and it still tasted like water... Really! He returned it and the manager came and apologized and took it off our bill. Our server apologized as well, but certainly not his fault.  But they were very kind about it and professional. I appreciate that!

I have been to several Red Robins and they are all pretty much the same.  My son loves them but my daughter agrees with me that its basically mediocrity at its best.  This one is no different.  If you have not been its like a typical American bar restaurant (like a slightly lower class version of TGIFridays).  There portions are slightly smaller then normal and the prices are not smaller.  The staff here mirrors the food quality.  I like the every kind of everything on the wall but hardly enough to come often. Note I got the Octoberfest hamburger and its so not worth getting and the wings had a weird aftertaste.  The steak fries were the best thing on the plate.

"Their Gourmet Burgers weren't ...& the service was Worse!" Red Robin claims they are making "Gourmet Burgers" and at upwards of $15. bucks each (for some) they should be! 4 of us went for an early Saturday Dinner. My friend & I ordered the Burgers, my wife a wrap & his wife a large fancy salad.  Being 4:30 and not jammed yet there shouldn't have been any service problems but.... After ordering, the waiter told our friend they didn't have any hard boiled eggs (?) for the salad would she like to substitute avocado... she said yes. We sat & talked for awhile when we realized it was about 20 minutes and no food yet then the waiter finally stopped by and said "Coming up soon".  Finally the food came.  My wife said her wrap was OK.  My "Gourmet Burger" looked O.K. but when I bit into it the Onion Bun tasted like it had just come out of the fridge...it wasn't toasted or heated at all...the meat was NOT handmade gourmet but seemed to be a frozen patty and it was tepid, not hot... AND the "Bottomless Fries" were ice cold. My friend said his Burger was the same.  I assumed the food had been sitting for awhile before it had been delivered.  I flagged down the waiter and told him about the Cold Fries he said.."...oh they're a little cold?"...I said "NO they're ice cold"...he said "No Problem & off he went". Awhile later the waiter brought a plate of Hot Fries. Then our friends wife said "they didn't add the extra avocado she was supposed to get"? The waiter said "No Problem"... off he went for another 15 minutes...then out came two slivers of avocado...Our friend asked for more Bottomless Fries..."No Problem"...the waiter said then disappeared forever. About 15 minutes later a girl walks up and says "I'm you're new waiter can I help you"...we said we were still waiting for our "Bottomless" Fries...she brought them immediately. Summing up ...Friendly but bad service...Overpriced and Cold Food... Not worth the trip again!!!

Brought my kids in on a school fundraiser night, the server was courteous and quick, the food came out in a timely manner, and no one looked at me sideways for ordering a cocktail. Pretty good experience pin a busy fundraiser night.

The food was delicious. The staff even greater. My 89 year old mother fell outside the restaurant while I went to get the car. They came rushing out to help her. Many thanks to both of those gentlemen. Service goes beyond the food.

This is probably the worst service in TO when it comes to restaurants. Not my choice, but my daughter loves this place, like most 9 year olds probably do. We went a couple of days ago, and the service was terrible. Waiter sat us down, took our drink order of "two waters" and returned about 15 minutes later to bring us the water. Then, he took our order....food was brought out about maybe 20-25 mins or so, so not too bad of a wait. Drops the food off, but the table never had an napkins or silverware placed on it. It took me about 10 mins to hunt down ANY waiter member, and I ended up grabbing the hostess to ask for napkins and forks. Our food was cold due to the waiting, and the hostess disappeared for about 5 mins and brought us the items. Really? The place was NOT busy to be taking forever. I was so irritated and normally I could care less. Every time I go, I feel like the place is over staffed, kind of empty and yet the service still is painfully sloooooow. Don't even bother!

The restaurant was packed but even still our server Rachael was not friendly. She never smiled. the salad I ordered was on such a small plate to cut the lettuce. By the time our server came to check on us I asked for a larger plate and she rolled her eyes on me but said sure. I waited 8 min to get an extra plate. My husband was half way done eating by the time I got a plate. Plus when my husband got his food the fries were cold. She didn't apologize. Just said ok. My husband had to ask for new fries. We never say a manager. Poor restaurant service. Coming from the industry myself I was very disappointed.  Won't be going back.
This place is just OK.  I do not recommend their turkey burger as the patties are pre made.
Pretty good. I always end up here because Lazy Dog is too packed. Red Robin has a full bar, good drinks, good food and good service.

The management staff of this resteraunt is so poorly run, and lacks complete communication between them and vendors.  If management lacks the mental capacity to make common sense decisions I would be afraid to see what that kitchen looks like, or how other staff members maintain their duties.  Eat somewhere else you might be saving your life.

As a fan of Red Robin, I consider myself a regular at the Thousand Oaks location. Time and time again, I have been very pleased with their prompt and thorough service. I'd recommend this to anyone who has time to sit down and enjoy a great family experience.

I went to Red Robin recently for a friends birthday.  We ordered drinks which are pretty good!  Unlike what the category above says, they have all kinds of alcoholic drinks, not just beer and wine.  Let me just say though, the "Flat On Your Beak" drink is very strong! Our waitress was very friendly!  We had a decent size group so I applaud her for accommodating us (well they would have to anyways).  The food was good, for the type of place Red Robin is.  I ordered the Southwest Pasta and it was just the right amount of spicy.  The options aren't as healthy as I would have liked, but its a burger joint, so that was expected. But overall, I was pleased with the service and the food :) Enjoy!

Red robin is by far one of my favorite restaurants. They always have different interesting burger combinations. I always get the regular hamburger with fries and a house salad. My girlfriend usually gets a chili burger or a red tavern burger double decker. So bomb!!  The only thing I would have to say really irks me is sitting in the bar area. Usually when u get there early they sit u in there. I would've thought it would be exceptional service seeing as how they had no customers but my mom and I. So we got drinks, then ordered, and then proceeded to wait 40 min for a salad and hamburger. Other people sat down 10 min after us and got their food before us. And then the waitress we had disappeared and he bartender didnt even know what happened to our order. Ugh.. Not to mention out waitress showed up at the very end to collect money for the bill. So disappointing. Ill keep going to the one off of calabasas

Haven't been here in a long time and decided to stop before a movie. Certainly the place went down hill since I was last there. First the drinks didn't taste like they used to and the food was cold and no tasty at all! When complained the manager came and she was so unfriendly. Long story short they even made me pay for the drink after the bad experience. Definitely not going back. Yuck!

I usually don't go to places like this but I was overall impressed (maybe because expectations were low) I love how you can substitute a veggie patty for a meat patty for no charge, or a salad for fries too, or any type of bun. I got the turkey sandwhich with green chiles, cheese, garlic aoli, and bacon. It was PACKED with delicious turkey and I got it on a whole wheat bun instead of texas toast ( to save a couple calories and add fiber). The Whole grain bun could barely handle all the moist cheese n turkey but it worked. Fries were pretty good, a little bit undercooked but pretty crazy they are 'bottomless'.  Server Dana was very attentive and kind. Drinks were never empty. Great place for Vegetarians believe it or not because the Boca burgers are soo dang huge and delicious. Plus they have some hummus appetizer. I think they are really trying to jump on the healthy train.

Love Red Robin! So glad to now have one in TO and like everything in TO it's all about the service. This Red Robin has some of the best servers I have ever met. These guys and girls are on top of their game! And the food! Gotta thank the kitchen staff for their hard work. The food presentation is immaculate and the taste delicious. To sum up this is a great place you and your buddies can hit up for lunch or dinner before catching a movie or hitting the town.

Steve, The General  Manager At This Red Robin Is Truly The Best In The Bizz!!! He Always Gives The Best Service and Commands The Same From His Team.  Simply The Best Experience Every Single Time We Visit.   Thanks Steve and Team!!!! Keep Up The Great Work!!!!

This was ok.. Nothing special .. I've had better hamburgers at  fast food restaurants without the high dollar price.. I was told my French fries were endless, funny because I never got a refill nor was never asked if I wanted more .. The burger itself was so so, kinda bland , my sons was a bit better but cost wise it was more than mine.. The service was just ok, nothing worth mentioning .. Should have gone to smash burger like we  originally planned, we just happened to be at the mall at the time that's why we ended up at this location..  Oh well I'll get my smash burger next time...

Gourmet,  my tokhas. Precooked, stale meat. They lie right to your face and tell you it is fresh cooked. Wait forever and get cold food. Hope you don't get one of those part time college kids to wait on you.

Will never come here again. Tried this place 4 separate times. First time was fine. The last 3 times have been terrible.  Service is EXTREMELY slow. Poor management.  I order the same thing every time - a grilled chicken salad. It's supposed to come with bread. Literally the last 3 times I've come here I never get the bread. So I can't just say "they forgot" the first time it happened. It's like they skimp you on the little things to cut costs wherever possible.  Cucumber in my salad was bad last time I went. The chicken used to come out hot, lately it comes out half frozen as if it had been cooked previously and left out all night until someone ordered it. Ew. --- The very last time I came here it was dead slow (I wonder why) and it took over 40 minutes for us to receive our food.  One of the waitresses took her lunch and ate her food in front of us and the other 3 tables in our section that had ALL been sitting without entrees for over 40 minutes.  Staff was extremely unapologetic about the wait. When the food finally did come out it was cold. The table in front of us sent theirs back. The table behind us was had their appetizer completely forgotten. And have of my entree was "missing" as well.  The waiter asked if I wanted a refill on my iced tea.. Took him over 10 minutes to bring me a new one, it only came out with our food. If it was busy, that's one excuse. But the place was dead. Very poor service. I don't think I will ever return.

I ordered the chicken breast plate and the chicken was so small and over cooked. The salad it came with was C-.  Service was very slow. Thank goodness we were not in a hurry.  I won't be coming back here anytime soon. The Red Robin in Simi is much better.
Great service and food. However the booth table and seat were both sticky...not ideal

Xlint food, hit or miss service.  Our most recent visit was a classic example.  The server was friendly, the food was hot and well prepared but they forgot our salad appetizer.  Hamburgers were excellently prepared, "Bottomless" fries were hot and crispy, and the chocolate milkshake was the perfect consistency.  A nice feature is the ability to print and pay your check at the table. Overall a good dining experience. Who needs salad anyway.

Loud, sound echo.  Sadly I have had the same incompetent waiter twice in a row.  First time he forgot the appetizer altogether, so I cancelled the order for the appetizer... .the next time I only ordered a bowl of soup, nothing else and he brought the soup but no spoon, then disappeared.....soup cooling, no spoon....looked around a lot, didn't see him, got a different waitress to help me.

This Red Robin has always been consistently good both for food and service. The appetizers, burgers and fries are very good and the wait staff has always checked in after food arrives and seem to be very experienced and professional.

Red Robin is definitely one of my favorite places.  Went here last night (Friday) with a friend to celebrate my birthday - which was the previous day. Anyway, apparently a lot of dads wanted their hamburgers and to watch the Kings win; it was pretty packed. Only a couple of 2 person booths were empty. A lot of smaller tables had been put together for groups of over 6. But I digress. This is an awesome place. Usually I have no problems with food/service/etc. Yesterday, though, our fried zucchini (which I am obsessed with), was haphazardly cooked. My friend split a piece in half and we saw that there was flour and uncooked egg/flour mix against the zucchini. Was also a bit harder to bite into than I'm used to.  Now, I appreciate their attempts to move forward in the technological world. What I don't like is them appearing like Stacked. That place is ok, but over-priced. I liked the original Red Robin, where waiters and waitresses take the orders so the food can be customized and quesitons can be asked. That's what tips are for. Not them dropping off the food. The ordering pad was a sticky mess that we couldn't navigate because they were so busy we didn't get a waitress to show us how it works, so we kept having to press the "call server" button. Also - we had.... 3 waitresses. It was frustrating. They were nice, but it drove us crazy. That's how busy it was. I'm just venting though. Usually everything is great. Apparently it's best to ignore holiday weekends completely.  Quick menu synopsis: Hamburgers = awesome! They don't mess up on how to cook the meat. Soups = soupy goodness! Bottomless anything = bang for your buck! (Just make sure to press the "call server" button) Shakes & malts = cold deliciousness! Strawberry lemonade = childhood summertime memories! Cod filet (fish & chips) = I ordered this yesterday. Normally cooked to perfection. They had the same smidge of a problem as the zucchini. They're forgiven since it's still fresh and tasty. Overall, still go, don't take to heart the 3-star rating. Make sure to beat the peak-hours. Early birds for happy hour and elders before 7, cocktail times, or early lunchers. Try for late lunches and 7+pm dinners.

I love the service! I really like this one waitress here that I always want to be waited on. This one girl who always does her hair up really cute with the flower. She's waited on me twice once when I was here with my family and once with my friends before I saw The Avengers at midnight. Ohh, I wish I could remember her name! She's always so darn sweet and she seems genuinely happy to help us it puts a smile on my face. All the other waitresses I've had besides her have also been great too. I always get the Royal Red Robin Burger and the Freckled Lemonade. And usually the fried mushrooms for an appetizer. I come here when I want to eat my feelings. Both always arrive hot and taste really good and I also love when a new hot basket of fries comes up when I have room for it. I don't care if they are frozen or fresh at all. I just don't want to know whatever it is I love those fires! Before this Red Robin opened up I would have to go to Simi or Calabasas. I was ecstatic when this location opened! This one that has opened up has great quality and wonderful service so I'll always be coming back as long as I'm living in Thousand Oaks.

The drinks here are amazing and favorite dish to get here is the Side Mac n' Cheese! Perfect portion and super delicious! The service here though is very slow and it seems like the waiters don't even care. It wasn't even crowded when we went and we had to wait about 1 hour before getting waters and they didn't even bring everyone's food at the same time.
One of the best burgers I've tried go for it with the fried egg the best good service too def be back too :)

Eh, I go back and forth with this place.  I definitely want to like it more than I do.......and the ONLY reason they get the 3 stars is because it's new and clean inside this location.  They seem to have an issue with bringing hot food (that is supposed to be hot).  I don't know what their problem is, and it's not just limited to this one.  The burger is always lukewarm........and that's if I'm lucky.  I always, and I mean ALWAYS order their Calif. Chicken Burger, which has glorious guac in it, but minus the bacon, and while it tastes really good, I'm battling the heat factor.  If I'm expecting a freshly cooked meal, it'd better be hot upon arrival.......not so hot that I burn my tongue, but I'd better be able to feel significant warmth on my tongue.......and I rarely if ever do at these restaurants.  Their argument has been (sometimes) that the lettuce and tomato cool it off.  Give me a break..... then why is it always the right temp. if they bring it out just after cooking......with the same cold lettuce and tomato touching it?  Nice try, but I wasn't born yesterday.

If it weren't for Sarah (Manager) & Emily (Waitress) this last visit would have gotten a single star review...I work alot and don't get out much so we  decided to see a movie at Movico and have dinner here with family. We came an hour and half early with a party of 5 and was told the wait would be 20 minutes, after waiting about 30 minutes we asked how much longer because now we were getting nervous we might miss the movie we already bought tickets for and was told they weren't sure and was waiting for people to leave.
