I saw a few smaller tables open so I asked the hostess if we split our party up could we get seats faster because we were pressed for time and she said maybe, she wool check and let me know. I preceded to watch parties of 2 & 3 walk in put their name on the list them get seated..now my wait was up to 45 minutes (over double what I was originally told) and I didn't think we would have time to eat and see the movie and since I had not eaten all day I figured I would ask for a manager before I left to express my disappointment and then go to the mall food court which I really did not want to do. I spoke to Sarah the manager on duty and she handed me menus and said to decide what we want and she will put the order in so the food would come fast and she would get us a seat all together which she did in a timely fashion..still worried about not having enough time to eat and make the movie we decided to trust Sarah and I am glad we did. She brought Emily over to be our waitress and she was immediately on top of things, it felt like I was back on set with craft services...Sarah offered us an appetizer on the house, food and drinks came quickly. Food was hot and delicious and the overall exprerience was great considering how it all started...in my opinion this place should strive to find more employees that have a positive attitude such as Sarah and Emily, then everyone would give this place a 5 star review!

Tried it again - I keep trying - it is getting worse - one suggestion - don't sit in the bar or at any of the tables on the dining side of the wall near the front door and bar - the bartenders serve you there too - and they could care less about you - they would prefer tips from those ordering drinks.

i just went to red robin for the first time in thousand oaks.first of all the rewards program is a   husband and i signed up for the rewards and had to call coorporate headquarters because it never registered and what a hassle we went through for nothing.the discount is terrible.then the food is not great and the prices are terribly pricey.the service was not great either.i dropped some food on the floor by accident on their wobbly table and the server would not pick it up until after we got up and left.this place does not belong in thousand oaks.all around not a good place.

Came here, was a 20 minute wait for two on a Saturday night and was really crowded! Pretty good, bottomless fries are always good :)  Personally, I've had better burgers at other Red Robins, but I can understand because it was so busy in there. Really good service though! Our server checked on us a lot of times and even refilled my coke without me having to ask! YAY!

We recently moved to the area and this Red Robin is at the Oaks Mall, which makes it a great place to eat after shopping or before a movie. Frankly I didn't really go to any Red Robins before but my husband loves their freckled lemonade with real strawberry slices. Now I'm hooked too! Also really appreciate how the servers always offer to give us a lemonade to go at the end. Their burgers and fries are also consistently good, and I like how the fries are bottomless. The happy hour selections are reasonable too; we usually get two appetizers for $5. Although the food tends to be a little too salty, this place hits the spot whenever we're in the mood for burgers and lemonade.

Only sat down at the bar on a Saturday night. Was kind of empty and we got fast service. Got a few beers, blue moon and 805, both real good there. Bartender was really nice and helped me choose my drinks, even let me taste test some beers. Wasn't happy hour but they have it to me and my friends anyways! Great experience, will go back to just catch up and drink with some friends again. Great service, cheap alcohol, and good environment

This place was terrible. My daughters Mac n cheese came out still frozen and when they brought it back it was scorching hot. Our burger tasted like rubber and the service was average at best. I wasn't  expecting 5 star quality and even with low expectations it ended I ended up with 1 star food and 2 star service. Last time at Red Robin in Thousand Oaks.

My overall experience was pretty good the waitress was great always had a smile on her face. The burger was amazing. I went once to a red robin but I didn't like the experience there meat tastes weird but at this red robin there meat tasted good and I didn't like the fries so much but the burger was terrific. I will defiantly be coming back

FOOD POISONING!!!!! After the 'pleasant experience' of being sick from food poisoning, I talked to the 'manager Tony'. All he said was 'Sorry. Good bye' NOTHING like, 'Wow, I am so sorry that happened, what can I do to make this up to you? Thank you for letting us know! We will look into what could have caused the problem' ETC!! Wow, thank you so much! I USED to be a pretty regular customer, but FORGET IT!!! Guard your stomachs!! (Got a Patty Melt)

Poor service. My family and I love Red Robin, reasonably priced and good atmosphere. This location, however, has gone down hill since its recent renovation. I'm pretty sure they must have changed management because my gripe isn't with a particular server or host, it's with the overall service of the entire staff which is almost always a reflection of management. First, when I entered the restaurant the hostess just stood there until I asked for a table, no "hi welcome to red robin or at least "welcome", just a blank stare.  Second, it took 15 minutes to get someone to take our drink order. Third, they forgot to bring out the appetizer and decided to just deliver it AFTER our main entrees arrived. Um, by that point an appetizer is pointless. Fourth, the bartender slid my beer down on our table and  just walked away. Not that big a deal, but maybe a "here is your beer" would be a little better approach rather than acting like it was a chore to bring my $7 beer.  Fifth, it took 10 minutes after we said we were done to finally get our check. Considering we had already been there for over an hour because the food took so long to get to our table, our kids were antsy, and it wasn't a busy night! It took so long my wife had to leave with the kids before I could even pay.  Our last visit was the final straw. We've noticed a change over the last few months in the declining level of service but decided to brush it off each time. Not anymore though... Until this location changes the way in which they treat their customers we won't be back. Very unfortunate.

Wouldn't come here again. Waited 20 mins when the restaurant was half empty on New Year's Eve. Services was super slow and the food was gross. My husband got the big burger. Took three bites and it was raw. I got a salad and it tasted like dirty. Bummer, was looking toward to a simi good dinner.

Food was delish as always!  Love the bottomless fries and unlimited drink refills.  Our server was very upbeat and helpful.  We signed into their new checkout computers at the table and were able to add to our order, call the server, see our bill and even pay the bill.  This helped us leave the restaurant with our antsy boys as soon as we were finished.  Have always loved the food and now with this new add-on, we will definitely be coming more often!

I have visited other Red Robin restaurants where the food and service were fine, so was expecting a similar experience here for lunch.  I ordered the whiskey river BBQ burger and my friend ordered the same burger but with chicken, instead of beef.  Both ordered sweet potato fries, so an easy order (or so we thought!).  Our food arrived within about 15 minutes - my burger was there, but my friend's chicken burger seemed to have become a chicken wrap, in a spinach tortilla and had not fries.  Clearly they had messed up the order so I got started eating my burger, assuming my friend's would arrive any minute.  Another 10 - 15 minutes went by before my friend's chicken burger arrived.  My fries were pretty cold and the burger didn't really taste of anything, certainly not like the description on the menu. By the time my friend's burger arrived, I was almost finished eating and there was only a mumbled apology from the waiter - he said the kitchen must have missed the order. When a similar thing has happened in other restaurants, they often offer to comp a part of the meal, or even a drink to make up for their error - no such offer here. The price of over $15.00 for an iced tea and a burger with a small portion of sweet potato fries (not 'endless' fries, at least we were not offered any more) is definitely not worth it - I don't plan on returning.

I come here with my family sometimes to celebrate birthdays.  The food and the service is always good and fresh.  I love having refillable French fries which is the best thing ever.  I love this place.  I would recommend this place to anyone who loves endless fries like I do.  Thanks Red Robin.

Bad bad service, cold food that takes for ever to come and in our case yesterday refill on fries never came. Asked 3 times for fries refill, then asked the manager and still it never came. Very disappointed, will not go to that location again.

Two words: service sucks. Don't even waste your time on a Saturday night! Both people next to us on each side said the same thing, that the service was SO SLOW. One couple got their food before they ever even got anything to drink. We ended up having like 3 different servers come to us but still, it would have been better to have just one reliable attentive server. We ordered fish and chips and the batter wasn't even hot and it was chewy. We won't be back!

Located outside as part of the Thousand Oaks Mall- plenty of parking as well. Have been to a couple other Red Robin locations- one in the valley. I must say the menu is extensive and the staff is very nice- staff wise this pertains to each one I have been to.  I had the bleu burger, great flavor- minus the bleu cheese! I was a bit disappointed that I could not taste it one bit. it also had cripsy onions. I asked for onion rings for about $1.50 extra, which I expected more than 4 rings. But the sauce that came with it was quite good. Overal, decent but again a bit disappointed with the lake of Bleu cheese taste. I would come back and give it another try because they do have some good selections I would  like to try.

If you've been to the Cheesecake Factory at the Thousand Oaks Mall, you might recall a restaurant across the way called Sisley.  I used to go to Sisley because the Cheesecake Factory had too long of a wait. That's how I ended up at Red Robin.  The wait at Lazy Dog Cafe was 1 hr., and I wanted to eat right away.  Please note that neither my husband nor I are burger people.  Red Robin's menu highlights gourmet burgers, but we had a BBQ chicken sandwich, a BBQ chicken wrap, and a french onion soup.  Both came with fries.  Our dishes were fine, but my husband noted that his soup was very salty.  So, while the food wasn't bad, it also wasn't awesome.  It's not a place I would seek out, and if I did have a hankering for a burger, I'd be inclined to visit Island's.

My husband and I went to Red Robin Saturday night. We thought there would be a long wait since it a Saturday night. We didn't have to wait for a table however the service was absolutely horrible. It took at least fifteen minutes to take our drink order and our waiter hardly checked on us. The restaurant was only half full if that. I don't even want to bring up how dirty the restroom was. We will not be going back.

Pros: Great deal for happy hour apps. Dog-friendly patio. Cons: Even if they're not busy, they sometimes forget that you're outside. The heating lamps don't have range. Overall: Not a bad alternative to The Lazy Dog Cafe and usually not as busy if you're dining with a dog. But the patio is a little cold so you're better off waiting for a table at The Lazy Dog Cafe.

Sad all the way around. Hubby ordered a bacon burger w/ onion on the side,  a patty melt for me, both Cooked "pink" and an iced tea w/ lemon and water. Lettuce, tomato, onion and mustard on the side. Not too complex, right?  Right away the waiter didn't bring the lemon and forgot to ask me what kind of cheese I wanted on the melt. Oh, oh, should have been our first clue. Almost 30 minutes later, we got our well done burgers and cold fries. Our fries "upgrade" to the herb, garlic, parm and parsely specials were unbelievably bad (Smash burger has nothing to worry about if RR is trying to compete with theirs). Two pieces of shriveled parsley, no garlic, a few slivers of parm, no oil and TONS of salt. Our burgers were delivered with none of the sides. When we reminded the meal deliverer (who was not the waiter), she brought them all on the same plate and also  someone I assumed was the manager. I told her both burgers were overcooked and she did her best to convince me there WAS some pink in there (somewhere). She did offer to re fire the burgers and bring new fries, but we were too hungry and (fortunately) had a gift certificate, so we weren't "technically" paying for the meal. Thankfully...or it ALL would have gone back to the kitchen. I have never written a review but felt compelled. The bill was just shy of $26.00 and NOTHING was correct with the order. I told the manager that  The Habit did a better job...she seemed surprised. After reading some of these other reviews, I don't think she should have been.  C'mon...how difficult is it to make a decent burger and fries...cheech!

Friday night for 2 to redeem my bday burger. Outstanding service by Monica. We were both just watching and listening to her and after she left the table to submit our order we both looked at each other and said Wow! Food quality and taste were outstanding.
Their food was pretty good but the service wasnt that great; they mixed the order twice....

As soon as we walked in, the greeter didn't even greet us. Then I asked for patio seating for 3 (I saw that there was 3 tables available),  only one other family waiting in front of us. When our turn came to be seated, she said there's no tables available!!!!! Then she tried seating us in a table for two!!!!Clearly,  there's 3 of us!!!! It gets worst......I'm still waiting for our food for 41 minutes since we ordered.!!! I am very disappointed,  never coming back here.

The service here is "off the charts"! My 2-year old nephew forgot his treasured Curious George doll, we came back several hours after looking all over (cries and tears included), and they had it ready for us. A very happy young boy, and family! Plus their Prime Rib Dip w/ Fries is highly recommended.

Fun place to meet up with friends and have a good burger but honestly it is chaos in there! We ordered appetizers to pass the time and got them served to us WAY LATE when our dinner was being served. Well obviously if we wanted our appetizers with dinner i would have not ordered them at all! Then we ordered alcoholic drinks and were brought the wrong drinks and one of them had no booze. I get that they are busy, but they need better organization.

The customer service here is amazing. The server was energetic and very charismatic. My girlfriend and I were very happy with the experience here. The server was very helpful on all our questions. Will be coming back for sure.

One thing to say about this location-bad management.  Everything was wrong the wait-30 mins with some open tables dotted around the restaurant. The service-way slow not enough servers for the crowd.  Food too slow and left under the lights too long.  Finally the whole place was cold really cold inside - they just need to turn up the thermostat.  No way all these things can go wrong at once unless management is simply squeezing every dime out of a popular place by skimping on staff.

Superior customer service. Attentive, cheerful and way above average. Management certainly knows how to treat a diner and make it a pleasant visit. Most refreshing. The mushroom burger was loaded with fresh sautéed mushrooms. Ask for tomato and lettuce if you want it a bit more dressed up. Perfect cooked as requested, medium grilled. The endless steak fries are fat, crisp and more where they came from at any sign of a close to empty dish. Loved the smaller sized lunch burger, $6.99 and added a house salad, crisp and freshly made. I got my monies worth, good solid food and a nice experience.

The first two times I went it was awesome!  I always get the crispy chicken and its packed with flavor but we went today and it wasn't the same my bf didn't enjoy or even finish his plate and well I was hungry so I finished mine but I was expecting it to be as good as always. Our waiter was awesome! I forgot his name but he was great he seemed so nice and well happy to be there... Whether that was all fake or not it was still nice! Everyone always wants a happy waiter who attends you well and isn't hating their job or in a crabby mood so I give him 5 stars... I know he works the bar but I can't remember his name unfortunately ... Oh well... I guess I'd go back but can't say how soon lol I'd really have to want it :)
Just went to lunch there with my 2 kids, had a great time.  Food was yummy and service was great!  Planning on going back next time i am in the area.

First time to this Red Robins & i was very impressed with the service.Our waitress (Julie) was amazing.She was very outgoing,funny and helpful with recommendations.She came every other minute to check on us,asked us for refills & brought us napkins without me asking,also asked if we wanted a side dressing.I felt very welcomed.Julie totally made a great experience for all of us.The food was amazing,it was cooked right & fast.Julie also kept the bottomless fries coming .Overall was a great Experience.Thank you Julie.Thats what being a great waitress is about.

So... My boy and I went to this Red Robin after both not having been to a Robin in ages, expecting what normally comes from a visit to any Red Robin location -good burgers, solid service, fun atmosphere, etc.  While the atmosphere was there, everything else was dreadfully lacking.  I honestly couldn't believe our experience. First, and the biggest of complaints, was the service.  Our server seemed over-worked, like she had too many tables to attend to and that's not her fault.  She only refiled my water once and it was empty for about 70% of my time in the restaurant.   However, that's not the big whammy... When a customer orders a burger a certain way (absolutely plain) and the server forgets, the answer is never 'let's just scrape off what she didn't want on it,' which is exactly what happened.  The burger returned to my table after I sent it back wet in sauces I had previously asked to be removed, with small pieces of lettuce and tomato still remaining.  What's worse... I could actually see missing scrapes of bread where they tried to remove condiments and add-ons with a knife.  Ew.  Seriously, worst experience.  Honestly, if I was allergic, think of the consequences.  Absolutely poor service... a huge lawsuit waiting to happen.  Step it up, Red Robin.   Secondly, something was even up with my boyfriend's burger that night.  Super salty and in a bad way.  He's a salt lover and even he couldn't take it.  (Note:  He has eaten that same burger before at a different Red Robin location.  Huh... food for thought.) Anyway, I will not be returning to that Red Robin.  Who knows what I'll find in my burger next time.  Ugh.

Had a terrible experience here on Sunday afternoon! From the moment we walked in, all the staff members we saw looked pissed off. We were not greeted and when we were sat there was not even a smile on the girls face. The bartender was our server and there weren't many people in the bar area, but our service was lacking! Took forever to get iced teas and refills throughout our meal. There was a new person each time we needed something. We both ordered the bbq chicken wrap and soup combo and when our food should have arrived, we were approached by yet another person to tell us they were out of tortilla soup....VERY DISAPPOINTING! We should have been told when we ordered or JUST AFTER we ordered, not 15 minutes later. And the bartender/our server told us straight up he didn't want to deliver the bad news so he sent someone else out!...WTF?! I opted for a salad instead and before I could ask what dressings they had, the guy walked away!... I wanted to just leave at this point, but then another staff member brought out our food, without asking if we needed anything. I needed salad dressing! It took another 5 minutes before anyone else came over and then another 5 minutes to get the dressing.... The wrap was terrible and the balsamic dressing was too bitter. My dates fries were stale....even the iced tea had a "dirty" taste. I even asked for no tortilla strips on my wrap and the dressing on the side...guess what? It was made as they normally do and ignored my requests! I was fed up already so I just ate what I could, picking through the wrap. My date did the same as it was just bad food, bad service and an all around bad experience!  We will not be back.

Tonight was a night to remember! The meal was exceptionally delicious, and the service was amazing as well. I ordered the "Reds Tavern Double" burger and it was cooked perfectly and prepared exactly the way I ordered it with a starter of chips served with Guacamole and salsa. The highlight of the night had to be our server Emily! Not only did she make our dining experience an absolute pleasure, she was extremely witty, funny, helpful and delightful, smiles all around! She even helped me be more decisive in my decision making (which is hard to do since I'm extremely stubborn). Overall tonight was already going great, but with the addition of a delicious meal and Emily's outstanding service our night became even better!!!

They have gluten free hamburger buns that you can get with any burger or sandwich.  I have not have any bread since I was diagnosed with Celiac months ago and did not know what to expect.  I was so pleasantly surprised.  I guess they use Udi's buns which are delicious!  If you need gluten free and eat there you should ask for the fries & burgers without the seasoning salt (which is not safe).   The waitress was very nice and friendly.  She did switch my husbands burger with the one from another table but realized her mistake and came back immediately to fix it.  Drinks remained topped off and the food was above expectations.  Will return.  :)

Blah....have been here several times and am always left wondering how such a mediocre restaurant has such a prime spot next to the Muivco theater. Drinks have never been good. The food is not disgusting but it's definitely not good enough to waste money on either especially when it's about the same price as a wonderful restaurant right next door. If anything lower your prices to match the taste of the food!

Red Robin seems to have staying power when other similar restaurants (Chilli's) can't pull that off.  The food is above average for this kind of establishment but not quite able to compete with their neighbors Lazy Dog or Stacked.  Our server (Ryan) was great.  He took our order without writing anything down and then moved to another table to do the same.  I was doubtful he was going to pull off the orders but he did!  My wife's sandwich showed up missing the cheese and sauce and Ryan (followed by the manager) were on it instantly and deducted $5 off the bill.  They are now in our regular rotation of family eateries.
Kids everywhere....eeek! Amy is a great waitress. Wrote it down, read it back and gave an update...and checked back.
HUGE selection. Full bar, happy hours and great service. The best Red Robin I've been to.

Good American food here, not too pricey and I always enjoy my meal. Went here with my best friend so she could order her first legal drink! She got a mai tai (sp) and didn't like it so I sent it back for a pina colada. They not only exchanged the drink no questions asked but also brought us the extras! The service was fantastic and I enjoyed my experience!

We had just finishes watching a movie so we decided to have some dinner @red robin.  We were seated, ordered our drinks and an appetizer.  The cheese burger I ordered was burned on one side and pink on the other.  What do you expect right?  The fries were delish... Service was excellent.

The location is good for Thousand Oaks and the Oaks Mall. I like the patio for us to have a meal with our kid. The only problem is they might forget about you on the patio. A common problem at restaurants. Food is standard chain stuff.

The service here was just awful.  We went on a Tuesday evening and it was maybe 60% full.  We showed up at about 7:00 and we were going to a 8:10 movie next door so it seemed like plenty of time w/o rushing.  However, our server was so ridiculously slow.  The food is average and worth 3 stars probably, but they lose one for their terrible service.
Good service, fair prices, terrible food.  Would not go back.  Went with 6 people, all voted no on a return visit.

I had the Bleu Ribbon Burger which was pretty good for chain restaurant. The service was slow but cheery. Prices are reasonable and the place has the happy balance of being kid friendly and having a full bar.
Red Robin has amazing hamburgers! The service was great. The food was really good especially the appetizers. Also the strawberry lemonade really good!

The service was great.  We were seated as soon as we walked in and our server Heather kept our drinks full the entire time.  I signed up for the Red Royalty card....I'm curious to see what deals they'll give!
Mmmm mmmmm good! They can do no wrong in my book! fantastic food and service!

I love this place and now that they put the one in thousand oaks I dont have to drive to simi or calabasas... They even have a gluten free bread that you can get on any sandwich and it is amazing... It is also nice that it is all big portions so you can usually split a meal with someone and still be full...

Hamburgers here are pretty good. Hosts obviously don't like being there and the dining room is usually understaffed, which makes for pretty slow service, but my higher rating is directed to the bar area. The guy that is usually behind the bar when we go (I forgot his name) is great! He is friendly, efficient and keeps his eye on the table. He doesn't linger, but makes sure you are taken care of. Whether we sit on the patio or at a booth in the bar, he is great! Tip him well! He deserves it!
Not bad at all. Descent sandwiches and soup. A little more flair that I'd like but it is a chain that gets off on that stuff. Good French onion soup.  definitely go again

My family and I just finished lunch at Red Robin. A short, brunette girl introduced herself as our server and took our order. I had specified for the appetizer to come out first to our server. We waited over 30 minutes for the appetizer to come out after I had asked where our food was initially. When our wings came out , they were cold!! I complained to server Ryan and he mentioned he wasn't the server but will take care of the issue and have the kitchen re-fire the cold wings. Our server (the girl) stormed out of the restaurant and left. Guess she was done for the day and didn't bother telling us or introducing the new server. When Ryan came back with the wings  and the rest of our food, he apologized to us and said he is our server now. VERY CONFUSSING!! Mean while I thought for sure a manager would at least come by and check on u or apologize but we never saw a manager at all! Not even sure if they had one working. Finally the bill came and Ryan told our husband he was sorry again and that he asked the manager to take off the wings that took 30 minutes and were cold and the manager said know. WE aren't looking for free food at all but why would you tell a customer that your manager wouldn't take off the wings if I didn't even ask??!! It was a very slow day at Red Robin, poor service , poor food and poor management!!!! I wont be back and I hope corporate reads this and works on all of things to make it a better ran restaurant. Now I see why they were so slow today!!!

We visited the Red Robin at the Oaks Mall on 11/2. The restaurant was very busy. The folks responsible for cleaning tables/booths was doing a horrible job. We waited at least 10 minutes before the we were waited on.

We went here a couple of months after it opened and I asked for a gluten free bun because I had heard they had them.  The server said they didn't.  She even went and checked with the kitchen and confirmed.  I was sooooo looking forward to having a hamburger and sooooo disappointed that it wasn't going to be.  Now I hear they do have gluten free buns, so I guess I'll have to try them again.

I was pleasantly surprized.  Had a chicken sandwich which was rather good.  Have been to other Red Robins and had not so good service.  Convenient to Movico theathers for another option,  Will go again  Also signed up for royalty card which I hopefully will use.  Glad to have other options for movies.

I always sit in the bar area (usually no kids) and I enjoy this place for what it is.  it's always consistent, I always get what I order correctly (I'm a big modifier) and the servers and bartenders are always pleasant.  I start out with a basket of fries right when I sit down (they are endless, let's get the carbs and fat rain going quick!). They have fat free ranch dressing that they make in house that goes real nicely with the full fat fries, as does their buffalo sauce.  Burgers and sandwiches are tasty, but stay away from the salads. This is just not their thing, but they don't claim it to be.
I have never experienced bad food or bad service here. All the food I have tried has been very good, and I would recommend this place to anybody that likes burgers or sandwiches
i'm not a huge fan of burgers, but i like some of the creative drinks they have at the bar. plus its a great place to go because its barely crowded and has great servers.

I rarely ever had a problem with Red Robin, but tonight was the exception.  We were seated right away, but it took forever for someone to come over to even take a drink order and the restaurant was not crowded.  Other tables around us, with different servers,  came after us had their drinks already!!! The waitress (our bill said her name was Julie) did apologize for making us wait.  We ordered our drinks (bottled beer and a milkshake).  It took an exceptionally long time to get our drinks.  My boyfriend said it took 20 minutes to get our drinks...at that, the waitress became defensive and said it didn't take that long.  She came back and said it took 13 minutes (what?)  and in her defense, comped the beer.  It did take longer than usual to get our food as well.  When the waitress took our order, I gave her our loyalty card.  When the check arrived there was no mention of the loyalty card, and I had not received it back.  The waitress had told me she lost it.  Was not the relaxing dining experience I had envisioned.
